name: State_0

timeline_beats.label: Consolidation into a river-canton during River-Kingdoms
Age of Flux disruptions; migration influx under T4 protocols
Border War of the Lowlands (territorial loss, BC1 cession)
Integration into Coastal-River trade networks; Alliance A3 and TB2 membership

factions.label: Lowland Guilds
factions.influence_hint: Commercial control of river tariffs and reagent imports; dominant in ports

factions.label: Dike-Lord Nobility
factions.influence_hint: Controls irrigation, levies on grain; political-military elite

factions.label: Tide-Remembrance Clerisy
factions.influence_hint: Manages ancestor rites and navigation auguries; shapes public ritual life

factions.label: Frontier Settler Councils
factions.influence_hint: Push inland settlement; influence border policy and militia recruitment

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries exist but cannot replace charts or seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited; no high-pressure steam megatechs
notes: Strategic lowland position: commerce-focused, vulnerable at River Gate
Relies on imported ritual reagents controlled by Lowland Guilds
Recent border cession (BC1) shapes frontier settlement policy
Member of A3 and TB2; treaties T2/T4 constrain migration and boundary claims
